title: Drawing, "Project for a Set of Tableware", ca. 1820
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and black, yellow, and blue watercolor, graphite on paper, lined with green paper
markings: Watermark: Crest of a shield with X and ?
inscribed: Inscribed over each corresponding vessel in pen and black ink counterclockwise from upper right: Terina / Vaso Da Bottiglio / Posata / Nevette Per li Bicchieri / Zuppiera / Tazzeta Per le Salze / Porta Oglio / Vaso Per il Poncio / Tondio / Per Scaldare le Vivande / Saliera
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description:
Designs for dishes, eleven groupings in total, distributed across the sheet.
From top row: a tureen with two biforked handles and a vine slope on top.  The plate is in an upright position; caption, written in ink: "Zvppiera".  A fork, a spoon, a knife over an oval bowl.  Caption: "Posta"  and "Navette Per li Bicchieri"; a bottle cooler, "Vaso Bottiglia"; an oval covered bowl corresponding to the tureen, "Terina"; oval bowl as a saucer, the spoon is over it, "Tazzetta Per le Salze"; a cruet frame the handle consisting of three intertwined oval rings, "Porta Oglis"; a silver bowl, a spoon with a wooden handle is shown over it, "Vaso Per il Poncio"; a plate, "Tondino"; a plate warmer with a wooden handle, "Per Scaldare le Vivande."  Bottom center: a round salt cellar, "Saliera."  Two framing lines, blue stripe.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for a Set of Tableware", ca. 1820.
ca. 1820. Pen and black ink, brush and black, yellow, and blue watercolor, graphite on paper, lined with green paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5946.
